title: Shari Liu: How babies think about danger | TED Talk
excerpt: Are babies oblivious to danger? It's not that simple, says cognitive scientist Shari Liu. Sharing surprising insights (and plenty of baby videos) from studies of early human development, Liu highlights the unexpected ways babies perceive and respond to risky situations — and what these findings could unravel about the inner workings of our minds.

title: Why Is 13 Considered Unlucky? Explaining the Power of Its Bad Reputation
excerpt: The source of 13’s bad reputation – “triskaidekaphobia” – is murky and speculative.

title: The four horsemen of fear
excerpt: All fears can be divided into four broad categories which psychologists refer to as the four horsemen of fear: bodily, interpersonal, cognitive and behavioral fears. And each of the four horsemen of fear can be addressed by applying simple strategies.
